column3:
The file system operations in local file system and canonical path map
can be slow when done in serial for a large number of roots. Run
these in parallel on an executor.

On our benchmarks with about 8000 roots this saves ~700ms, or about 70%,
when setting watch roots.

Let me know if there's a better way to execute a bunch of tasks in parallel than what I added in ParallelUtil. Application#executeOnPooledThread isn't happy to accept 1000 tasks at once without starting to dump threads.
I updated the pull request to use BoundedTaskExecutor and removed the guava dependency. Benchmarks look the same.
Thanks! I added couple of comments inline
I changed the containers to ContainerUtil and iterate futures in reverse order.
Have you had a chance to look at this? Muchos gracias!
